text: Hello can we open new redirect url page with the help of any python library module in HubSpot like webbrowser module

Hello, I have a question about API keys deprecation on November 30th.
Does this affect Events HTTP API (<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/enterprise_events/http_api>).
If I understand correctly this API does not use the API key and should continue working after the deprecation? Thanks

Hi Team, you are you?
Is there any way to get the delivery status of an marketing email trough Custom codes via Workflow?
Yep it's the new user provisioning api <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning>
Can you give a little more detail about what you're trying to do?
Correct because that api doesn't require authenication you don't need to change anything when the api keys get transitioned out
Like delivery statistics?
If so you can just use this api <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/cms_email/get-the-statistics-for-a-marketing-email>
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1668769294722819>

Hello <@U01QVR44MEY> Thanks for your reply! Want I want to know is after I send the ME to the associated contact or contacts via WF they received it.  If not, then I would send a notification to our colleagues to investigate further or sent it again. We have detected that several times the contact is bounced and didn’t receive it.

I saw in the workflow action logs under Errors that HS is able to see if the emai was sent or not and I was figuring out of there is any API call I can made to retrieve the same information just after the email is sent
This api will tell you if a email address is bouncing <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/email_subscriptions_overview>
I don't know for sure but I think the new v3 apis will also tell you a similar thing
Is there any other reason for not send the email?
If the contact is unsubscribed
Or they have blockers setup
Is this something I can check via api?
Yep the above api will tell you their subscription status
All right. Then in my custom code I have to retieve the associated contacts and check if there is any blocker. If yes, then the email will not be sent right?
You won't know if there are any email blocks setup unless you first send the email, you can only check for subscription status and bounce status
But other then that yes the email won't send
Understood. This could be a workaround.
So. There is no api method to know if a specific event from a workflow failed

<@U01QVR44MEY> this is my authorize url
```<https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=xxxxxxxxxxxxx&redirect_uri=https://api.runalloy.com/api/strategy/HubSpot/callback&scope=crm.objects.contacts.read%20crm.objects.contacts.write%20crm.objects.companies.write%20crm.schemas.contacts.read%20crm.objects.companies.read%20crm.objects.deals.read%20crm.objects.deals.write%20crm.schemas.companies.read%20crm.schemas.deals.read>```
And does that work for you? or are you getting the same error?
CC <@U04AZN5JN9M>
yes, same error.
Did HubSpot changed there scopes ???
They changed them a while ago, did you copy the link above from where I told you to copy it from?
yes
from there i have past above URL.
Hello everyone, I’m using the API integrations but I need to do it some specific queries, is anyone who can help me with my doubts? :eyes:
what are you trying to do?
I need to use the endpoint  `GET*/crm/v3/objects/companies/{companyId}*`   and get the Customer Billing Type, is this possible?
also is possible filter by the specific type?
What exactly do you mean by billing type?
I need to get the value of that column
into my companies I have this property
Yeah you just want to add `?properties=billing_type` to the end of the url
ohhh, I was looking for the customer billing type
It might actually be customer_billing_type
I use it but it doesn’t return anything
Do you want to go to the property settings and see what the property internal value is called
You'll want to use this name in the url
where is the property settings?
:eyes:
Under settings=> objects=>companies>manage company properties
I have this
also I want to filter by type like customer_billing_type=‘Per Applicant’
is this possible?
It is you just have to use the search endpoint
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
Awesome, that’s helps me a lot!
thanks! :smile:
Of course
Is there a way to order site search by publish date?

Are rate limits applied per account, or per app? Say I have 2 private apps installed on my account. Can each consume 100/10s and 250k/day? Or is the quota shared by all private apps? Is the same true for public apps — a single account-wide rate for all public and private apps?

Searching shows similar conversations but couldn't find this specific detail
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details>
I read this; I wish it stated simply "each app is metered separately", or even "each private app" instead of "your private app".
For private apps it adds to the account total
But I don't think the same is for 'public apps'
You could test really quickly by checking the headers in the response of an api request
